newsitem.title: USA: Mars lander re-named after late space scientist Sagan.
newsitem.headline: Mars lander re-named after late space scientist Sagan.

text.p: The Pathfinder space vehicle that landed on Mars was re-named on Saturday the Carl Sagan Memorial Station, after the late space scientist.

"Carl Sagan was a very unique individual who helped young and old alike to dream about the future and the possibilities it may hold," said Daniel Goldin, administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration.

"Carl always liked to push the boundaries too, and the Mars Pathfinder mission, with its rover named Sojourner, clearly has done that," he said, announcing the re-naming of the craft that landed on Mars on Friday.

Sagan, a scientist and author who played a leading role in NASA's Mariner, Viking, Voyager and Galileo expeditions to other planets, died at the age of 62 last Dec. 20 -- 16 days after Pathfinder took off on its Mars expedition.
Talking of which, Goldin said: "Its very first images contain an array of fascinating scientific questions that he (Sagan) would have loved to debate.
"We will explore the area with his memory in mind."
